ControlModeEnumeration.description: Indication how the parameter is currently controlled

OTHER.description: This state is used if none of the other states below apply

STANDBY.description: Parameter is controlled to stand by value

ONLY_MEASUREMENT.description: The sensors deliver the current value but there is no controlling

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

data.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

ResetMonitoring.description: With this method the tolerance values are set according to the actual value and the set monitoring sensitivity

ActualValue.description: Actual value of the monitored parameter

AlarmSuppression.description: The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump

AutomaticMonitoring.description: Determination if monitoring tolerance parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

LowerTolerance.description: Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

LowerTolerance2.description: Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

MaxValue.description: Maximum absolute value of the process parameter

MinValue.description: Minimum absolute value of the process parameter

MonitoringSensitivity.description: Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetValue.description: Set/nominal/target value of the monitored parameter

Status.description: Information if the ActualValue is within the tolerances or has passed a tolerance or min/max value

UpperTolerance.description: Upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

UpperTolerance2.description: Second upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

data.description: Actual value of the monitored parameter
The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump
Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Maximum absolute value of the process parameter
Minimum absolute value of the process parameter
Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting
Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

AutoTuningOff.description: Stops an already active self-optimisation process (no control parameters are changed)

AutoTuningOn.description: Starts the self-optimisation of the controller

AutomaticControllerMode.description: Determination if PID Parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

AutoTuningActive.description: Informs if the automatic tuning is currently active

PIDParameters.description: PID Parameters as array if several input signals (sensors) are used for the control

items.title: PIDParametersDataType
items.description: Structure for storing the parameters of a PID controller

NOT_DUE.description: Maintenance of the device/component is not due

WARNING.description: Maintenance of the device/component is due in the near future

DUE.description: Maintenance of the device/component is due

Reset.description: This Method sets the RemainingInterval to Interval and Status to NOT_DUE_0

AdditionalInformation.description: Additional information on the necessary maintenance. Can be also a link to another document.

RemainingInterval.description: Interval before next maintenance is due

Status.title: MaintenanceStatusEnumeration
Status.description: Maintenance status of the machine/device/component (represented by the parent element)

TotalOperation.description: How long is the component running in total

data.description: Interval before next maintenance is due
How long is the component running in total

GetCurrentPage.description: Method for retrieving a screenshot of the control system with the currently shown contents

GetPage.description: Method for retrieving the image of a page of the control system

SetMachineTime.description: Method for setting the server time together with TimeZoneOffset

LocationName.description: Description of the location of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

PageDirectory.description: List of the pages that are implemented in the machine control system and are shown on the screen of the machine

items.title: PageEntryDataType
items.description: Information on a page that is implemented in the machine control system and shown on the screen of the machine

TimeZoneOffset.title: TimeZoneDataType
TimeZoneOffset.description: Difference of the local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) given by the machine operator or OPC client

UserMachineName.description: Description of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

LogbookEventsEnumeration.description: Information which LogbookEvents are supported by the machine

DeviceClass.description: Indicates in which domain or for what purpose a device is used.

Manufacturer.description: Name of the company that manufactured the device

SerialNumber.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies, within a manufacturer, a device instance

SupportedLogbookEvents.description: Information which LogbookEvents are supported by the machine

GetProductionDatasetInformation.description: This Method allows reading the description of a production dataset during the file transfer from the server to the client with ProductionDatasetTransfer

Description.description: Additional description of the production dataset

MESId.description: Id of the production dataset file assigned by MES

CreationTimestamp.description: Time when the production dataset was originally created or saved with a new name

LastModificationTimestamp.description: Time of the last modification of the production dataset

LastSaveTimestamp.description: Time when the production dataset was saved to the file system of the machine

UserName.description: Name of the user who has made the last parameter change on the machine

Components.description: Informs for which machines information is included in the file

Manufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

SerialNumber.description: Serial number of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

Model.description: Model of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

ControllerName.description: Name of Controller of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

UserMachineName.description: User machine name of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

LocationName.description: Location of the machine from which the production dataset file is generated

ProductName.description: Name of the product produced with this production dataset

MouldId.description: Id of the mould for this production dataset

NumCavities.description: Number of cavities of the mould for this production dataset
